item.title: OBAMA ADMIN SENT UNARMED BRITISH FIRM TO PROTECT U.S. MISSION IN BENGHAZI
item.description: Libya: Obama Admin Sent Unarmed British Firm to Protect U.S. Consulate http://t.co/YSU0jgZA
item.content:encoded: Libya: Obama Admin Sent Unarmed British Firm to Protect U.S. Consulate http://t.co/YSU0jgZA According to a source close to Breitbart News and high up in the intelligence community, the Obama administration's policy following Muammar Gaddafi's death has been to keep a "low profile" during a chaotic time. For this reason, according to the source, American Marines were not stationed at the U.S. embassy in Tripoli or the American mission in Benghazi, as would typically have been the case. In the spirit of a "low profile," the administration didn't even want an American company in charge of private security. Blue Mountain, the British firm the State Department hired, was willing to abide by the "no bullets" Rules of Engagement (ROE), so were a logical fit for the contract. These sub-standard protections for American diplomats were signed by Secretary of State Hilary Clinton in the ROE. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: 132 Inmates Escape From Mexico Prison
item.description: 132 inmates escape from Mexico prison http://t.co/yrb4zQCs
item.content:encoded: 132 inmates escape from Mexico prison http://t.co/yrb4zQCs PIEDRAS NEGRAS, Mexico (AP) — More than 130 inmates escaped through a tunnel from a prison in northern Mexico on Monday, setting off a massive search by police and soldiers in an area close to the U.S. border. Authorities in Coahuila state said the 132 inmates fled the prison in Piedras Negras, a city across the border from Eagle Pass, Texas, through a tunnel that was 21 feet long and 4 feet in diameter, then cut their way through a chain link barrier and escaped onto a neighboring property. Coahuila Attorney General Homero Ramos Gloria said the director and two other employees of the state prison have been detained for an investigation into the escape and are being questioned about possible involvement by authorities at the penitentiary. The prison houses about 730 inmates and the escape represented almost a fifth of its population. The tunnel "was not made today. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: NBC News: Obama Admin Lying About Security At Libyan Consulate
item.description: NBC News: Obama Admin Lying About Security At Libyan Consulate: UN Ambassador Susan Rice claimed this weekend th... http://t.co/f9NpcuOM
item.content:encoded: NBC News: Obama Admin Lying About Security At Libyan Consulate: UN Ambassador Susan Rice claimed this weekend th... http://t.co/f9NpcuOM UN Ambassador Susan Rice claimed this weekend that security had been increased at the US Consulate in Benghazi, Libya prior to the horrific attacks on Sept. 11. She even claimed "tragically, among those four that were killed were two of our security personnel." However, tonight, NBC News reports that "multiple US officials and other sources contradict that account. They tell NBC News that the two former SEALS Glen Dougherty and Tyrone Woods, who died trying to repel the attackers and who undoubtedly saved lives were not in Libya to provide personal security for the Ambassador or for consulate personnel." Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: Harsh Voter ID Law Sent Back
item.description: BREAKING: Pennsylvania Supreme Court vacates lower court ruling on voter ID law http://t.co/FoiYTnjJ
item.content:encoded: BREAKING: Pennsylvania Supreme Court vacates lower court ruling on voter ID law http://t.co/FoiYTnjJ In a potentially significant victory for Democrats, the Pennsylvania Supreme Court vacated a lower court's decision to uphold the states's restrictive new voter ID law on Tuesday, and asked the judge to consider enjoining it instead. The law, passed by a Republican legislature and governor, requires voters to have specific, state-issued photo ID -- a move that opponents say could disenfranchise tens of thousands of people, most of them minorities, students and the elderly. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com
